definition: to be perched high/to be located prominently/to be preeminent
male/staminate/grand/imposing/powerful/mighty/person or state having great power and influence

sentences.english: A good source is the book and DVD, "The Commanding Heights of the Economy."
sentences.chinese: 最好的信息来源就是书和DVD《经济雄踞魁首》。

sentences.english: This record topped the charts for six weeks.
sentences.chinese: 这张唱片雄踞排行榜之冠长达六周之久。

sentences.english: The song has topped the pop charts for five weeks.
sentences.chinese: 这首歌连续五个星期雄踞流行榜榜首。

sentences.english: With excellent quality and product diversification, Sika are in a top position in Chinese market.
sentences.chinese: 西卡凭着卓越品质和产品多样化雄踞中国市场。

sentences.english: His marks top the tally. He must be the champion.
sentences.chinese: 他的成绩雄踞积分榜第一名，冠军非他莫属。

sentences.english: Nestled in the Himalayas, bordering the world's highest peak, Mount Everest, lies tiny landlocked Nepal.
sentences.chinese: 珠穆朗玛峰雄踞世界屋脊喜马拉雅山颠。

definition: to tower/to stand straight (of person's bearing)

to come first in triennial palace examinations (idiom, refers to the carved stone turtle head in front of the imperial palace, next to which the most successful candidate in the imperial examinations was entitled to stand)/to be the champion/to be the very best in any field
to turn up one's nose/to show disdain for/to regard superciliously
lit. to proclaim oneself hegemon/to take a leading role/to build a personal fiefdom
to stand above/to occupy an important position/to rank (among the top few)
to hold a pass/to guard (a strategic location)
lit. only one branch of the tree is thriving (idiom)/fig. to be in a league of one's own/outstanding
lit. to stand like the three legs of a tripod/tripartite confrontation or balance of forces
